abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Sugar Rehabilitation Project
            (SSRP) in Jamaica. The main objectives were: (i) regulatory
            reform and preparation of the public sugar mills for
            privatization ;( ii) rehabilitation of specific irrigation
            systems, including infrastructure inves establishment of
            Water Users' Associations( WUA). Bank’s performance was
            deficient. Borrower’s performance was satisfactory. The most
            significant lessons learned were asment, training and
            extension services; and (iii) elimination of public
            subsidies for irrigation operation and maintenance costs
            (O&M) by introducing irrigation charges which cover
            O&M costs and encouraging the follows that: (i)
            restructuring of public sector enterprises, with a view to
            making them more efficient, usually is not successful; (ii)
            high quality appraisal is a sine qua non for a sound
            project; (iii) the Bank needs to be scrupulous when it
            deviates from Bank procurement guidelines; (iv) a
            sustainable project must be based on sound economic policies
            for achieving sectoral objectives; (v)irrigated farming
            development strategies. irrigation of sugar cane does not
            represent an efficient use of water; and (vi) the role of
            the government in the irrigation sub-sector should be
            limited to defining policies, enforcing legislation, and
            promoting sustainable
